how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;Journalling;As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: No, my TiddlyWiki is for personal use only
putting it all together, what value does: Structured notetaking in replacement of Microsoft OneNote.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...);I am comfortable writing filter expressions
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki through web browser with Download Saver (default saving mechanism)
how do you back up/sync changes between: No automatic sync across my devices

what are we doing well? prompts for thin: I really appreciate the dedication to local first, privately usable software and longterm usability.
what could we do better? prompts for thi: I would appreciate the availability of more "cookbook" style tutorials that show how to use TW's structure to make useful applications.  The reading list example that grokTW constructed would be an excellent use case.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
